commits.message:
Changed iSCSI udev rule to only trigger on 'add' (Fixes EUCA-13145)

Prior to this, our udev rule would trigger on add, change, and remove
events, causing ownership change on block devices attached to
instances (because libvirt sets ownership to 'qemu', while our udev
rule resets it to 'eucalyptus'). While the ownership may not matter
in this case, that change causes SElinux to relabel the file, which
makes blocks inaccessible inside the VM, resulting in I/O errors
inside the instance.
